content:
I think I found a solution.

In the Account Settings, Local Folder, Message Storage, Local Directory: /Users/josephlittle/Library/Thunderbird/Profiles/g2pl9flc.default/Mail/Local Folders/Sent.sbd

So, I changed that to: /Users/josephlittle/Library/Thunderbird/Profiles/g2pl9flc.default/Mail/Local Folders

All of a sudden (and as expected after looking at the folders and sub-folders) everything I was missing was shown.

After a re-start.

Less clear: when or why that Local Directory listing got changed. I am not sure what changed it. Not me (to my knowledge).

content:
Hi Jumpeeman,

I changed the POP mail server to mail.optimum.net and kept the port setting at 110. This resolved my problem, and the emails started downloading on my PC. I didn't have to change anything else and never went into "Trouble Shoot" mode.

Sounds like you fixed your problem, too. Hope everything worked OK after your restart!
creator: hasmort

content:
Hey Harry! I'm having the exact same issue with Optimum Online. And it started for ME on September 9th. What did you change your server name to? I've changed to mail.optimum.net, restarted and still not working.

Can you post your other server settings please? I'm stuck! Thanks in advance!

PS I can add that I'm on a Mac and am currently using Mac Mail in IMAP mode and it's able to send and receive my Optimum Mail just fine.

UPDATE!: Apparently solved! I randomly changed the Server Setting Connection Security Setting from "None" to "SSL/TLS". And hit "Get Messages" and it downloaded all the messages since 9/9! Crazy. . Optimum must have changed something on their end. . fricken nighmare. Anyway, I'm still in "Troubleshoot Mode" so we'll see if when I restart with all my add-ons activated, etc. if it still works. If not, I'll update, otherwise I think it's SOLVED!

UPDATE: Had to change OUTGOING server to SSL/TLS as well or it wouldn't send email.
creator: nyjumpee

content: Wayne - I checked the server settings, and the server name had to be changed. I looked up the server name online, put it in, restarted, and the emails downloaded as usual. Thanks!

content: Wizewiz is correct, but installing two versions can be tricky. 115 is still emerging, and features are being added or restored with each new release. If stability is paramount for you, then staying with 102 for now may work best, but if you want to enjoy the new system (which I encourage), then you should consider the upgrade. I encourage a full profile backup so, if you are dissatisfied, you can reinstall 102. If you are nervous on upgrading, then I suggest you try the portable version at https://portableapps.com/apps/internet/thunderbird_portable, which can be used in parallel with your 102 version (but you would need to copy the profile to the portable version after installation).
creator: davidsk

content: So nothing with 115 changes the profile files such that it cannot continue to be used with 102? Does that mean you can use 115 and 102 both against the same profile at different times? Thanks!
creator: scott168

content:
The developers have postponed offering updates from 102 to 115 for quite some time, and they now regard the update as a safe and smooth transition for most users. But if you're uneasy about it, the best way to do this is to go to the link below and click the Download link(s) and install Thunderbird 115 to a different folder (not the same one as your 102 files are in). Then you can set up and try 115 to your heart's content, and if you are happy with it, you can uninstall 102 without affecting your 115 installation. If you're not happy, you can uninstall 115, and 102 will still be there waiting for you.

https://blog.thunderbird.net/2023/07/our-fastest-most-beautiful-release-ever-thunderbird-115-supernova-is-here/
creator: danawilson001

content: If the account has been removed, they serve no purpose and can be removed.
creator: davidsk

content: Have you tried going to Settings > General > Reading, and choosing Open in New Tab? A double-click will give you a message window that's the full size of your Thunderbird window. I think you might have to open View > Layout and uncheck Message window first. I use Vertical layout; no message window, Cards view of the message list, and my messages open full-window in a new tab with an X on the top right for when I'm finished with that message, or I can just click the Inbox tab and the message list will appear, without closing the previous message. Works beautifully.
creator: danawilson001

creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Thank You Matt, the Problem was in #3. The SMTP Server had the same User Name in all 3 Accounts.

To be honest, it could be a bit simpler to manage these settings. There is the "Server Settings" Menu but this only deals with the IMAP Settings (Incoming). The SMTP Settings (Outgoing) are under the "Account Settings" menu at the end of that page. IMHO it should be listed on the "Server Settings" Menu. There is also a "Manage Identity" button in the "Account Settings" which also has the SMTP Server Settings. It could be a bit better organized... Anyway, problem solved. Thanks a lot!
creator: steve_k2400

content:
Let's start with the basics.

  1. Do you have three entries in the outgoing servers(smtp) in account settings?
  2. Is a different outgoing server (SMTP) set in the identity of each account. (the entry above server settings in the list)
  3. Does each outgoing server(SMTP) have it's own unique user name and password for the address it is used to send from? (Historically SMTP servers would be shared with the outcome you suggest you need one for each account)
  4. Are you using alias addresses in hotmail/outlook? They simply replace the information Thunderbird submits with the name etc they have online for the primary account when mail is submitted using SMTP.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: I found the problem, profile was corrupt. Make new install and new profile with new download from mail server.
